name: Entire Studio/apt in Buenos Aires
description:
The space
Inspired by the cultural legacy of wine in Argentina, Wine Suites is a place where travelers can rest easy and comfortable as at home, but at the same time, experience the authentic life of Buenos Aires, where the wine culture is an essential part of country's identity. Located in the exclusive neighborhood of Palermo Hollywood, Wine Suites consists of 3 apartments, Studio Torrontes, and Suites Mabec and Syrah.
Torrontes Studio is equipped with full kitchen, dishes and cooking pots, microwave, refrigerator, electric kettle, toaster and coffee maker. It also has air conditioning / heating, satellite TV, Wi-fi, digital safe, hair dryer, linen and a king size bed that can be separated into two twin beds.
Wine Suites has a large terrace for common use, with a large table of 3 meters long and a grill to enjoy a delicious barbecue and a good wine with friends.
host_about:
Vivo en Palermo Hollywood hace mas de 20 años y estoy en el negocio del Real State y B&B desde hace 10 años administrando propiedades destinadas al alquiler temporario.
Conozco muy bien el barrio y siempre dispuesta a recomendar los lugares que me gustan.

name: RELAX IN HAPPY HOUSE - PALERMO, BUENOS AIRES
description:
Beautiful cozy apartment in excellent location in Palermo.1 lovely bedroom for 2 people.1 functional bathroom w/running hot water.Spacious living room facing a small patio w/plants.Fully-equipped kitchen. One extra space with a single bed (no door not a proper room just a space). Lovely and comfy! :)

The space
ONE BIG BEDROOM
One lovely bedroom with a balcony facing the street that accommodates 2 people comfortably. Functional bathroom with running hot water. Spacious living room facing a nice small yard with plants. Fully equipped kitchen.
An extra space (no door & no wardrobe) that accommodates an extra person. Ideal for a child.

2° FLOOR BY STAIRS IN PALERMO NEIGHBORHOOD
You just have to climb two flight of stairs and reach home!

Guest access
LINEN, TOWELS, COFFEE, TEA & SUGAR: We provide clean towels, soap, toilet paper, linen and blankets. We also leave some coffee, sugar, tea and ingredients for you to use.
neighborhood_overview:
Palermo is such a perfect place to explore the city. It is really well located for sight seeing, as much as for enjoying peaceful moments, because it´s safe, and riddled with bars, cafes and restaurants.

CINEMA, GROCERY & ALTO PALERMO SHOPPING
You'll find a cheap chinese market around the corner and if you cross the street you'll find “Disco”, a well-known supermarket chain in Buenos Aires. You'll also find one of the most popular cinemas in town “Cinemark Palermo” and a great grocery with fresh fruit and vegetables. You're also just one block away from “Alto Palermo”, a shopping centre full of stores and restaurants and a big Starbucks' Coffee. There's also a Natural Food Market one block away from home!

ENJOY PALERMO!
Well, as you can see, you'll be staying in a privileged neighborhood and if you like walking around, you'll come across a coffee store, laundry, natural food market, convenience store open 24 hours, restaurants, and almost anything you ca
host_about:
Soy Organizadora de Eventos, me gusta relacionarme con las personas y conocer gente nueva.
Siempre que puedo me organizo algún viaje. Disfruto de conocer nuevas culturas y en especial su gastronomía. Los destinos de climas cálidos y playa son los que en general más me gusta visitar.
Así como me gusta viajar y sentirme bien recibida como extranjera, también me gusta recibir viajeros y hacerlos sentir como en su casa durante su estadía en mi país, del cual me siento muy orgullosa.

name: Great apt 1 Bedroom - 1.5 Bath /Recoleta
description:
The space
This great apartment is located in a very nice part of Recoleta. It is 4 blocks from the Recoleta cemetery. It is an impeccable apartment and has many unique characteristics and attractions like high ceilings, original openings, oak flooring and bathroom with marble, Jacuzzi-tub and amazing sink. The kitchen was specially designed with special custom made furniture. It has a wonderful view of the intersection of the Pueyrredón Avenue and the classic French street. This is a true 5 star property. Artwork in the living room featured by Anibal Carrillo.

It has been completely remodeled so it’s like a brand new apartment. It has the best of both worlds with old world charm and modern amenities and furniture. The apartment also has sound-proof windows.



The apartment is professionally designed and features European furniture and all the amenities of home. It is very spacious with 700 sq. feet of living space. The building is in am
host_about:
Hi, I'm Luciano and I'm Argentinian. I was born in Patagonia, but I came to live in this beautiful city many years ago to study at the university. I’ve also lived abroad –in Amsterdam- and travelled all around the world: needless to say…I love to travel.   
I have many passions: sports —running, hikking, tennis and -of course- soccer—, languages, tango and music; literature and cinema. I have friends from many countries and I enjoy hosting and showing them around, as I do with our guests whenever I have the chance.  My family and I offer several apartments in the best parts of town. We have been renting them for more than 16 years! We were one of the first ones in BA to join Airbnb back in 2010. It has been an amazing experience to be part of this comunity and we have had the chance to welcome people from all over the globe. 

Let me know if I can help you with your plans in la Reina del Plata, you are going to love Buenos Aires...

The space

The apartment is fully furnished, with cable TV, phone, Fast Wi-Fi connection, microwave, oven, refrigerator, air conditioning, bedclothes, table & kitchen utensils.

What you see on the photos is exactly what you will find when you come to the apartment: there are no photoshop tricks here. The place looks bright because it is NEW and immaculate because everything is very clean.

The neigbourhood is safe, lively and famous for its tango and theatre performances, historic cafeterias, and restaurants. All of them a few metres from our place.

The price

host_about:
I am architect, interested in arts, especially painting.
I love chocolate, Aki Kaurismaki movies, early mornings, photography...

I was trying to decorate our apartments nicely so that your stay would be more pleasant. I am recommending my guests places to visit, things to do. I was traveling around the world some years ago and I understand how stressful it is to look for a place to stay, to orientate in a new city.

Looking forward to hearing from you, 

Egle

name: SPECTACULAR ANCIENT HOUSE
description:
The space
I offer a big and ancient house in Villa Lia, 18 kms away from San Antonio de Areco.
San Antonio de Areco is a very famous rural town, visited by thousands of tourists every weekend. It is located 112 kms from the Capital City of Buenos Aires.
Villa Lia is a very quiet and nice town where you can enjoy peace and nature.
The house was owned by Villa Lia´s founders, and it is located in front of the train station, just where the town finishes and the country begins.
The place has capacity for 12 people. There is a living room, 4 rooms, a big and antique kitchen, a garden with a swimming pool and a grill.
The price includes blankets for all guests and a personalized and family attention.
This is a great oportunity to live a unique experience in Villa Lía, a typical ‘pueblo’, featuring all the attractions of the pampas rural towns.
If you stay for 1 week, the price is USD 700 for the whole house.

Guest access

In the upper level loft is a bedroom with q
neighborhood_overview: San Telmo is one of the best neighborhoods in the city of Buenos Aires, and the way to find out is living a few days in, enjoying its picturesque streets, taking a coffee in one of its notable bars or dining at any of the innumerable restaurants . Visit art galleries, going to museums, explore the Sunday antiques fair on Defensa, or play in a milonga tango dance watching local and why not learn a few steps. Also the weekend has lots of fun. I know many places to eat or get out, but do not recommend them because as long as you walk in my neighborhood I feel like newcomer, I think San Telmo always new things to discover secretly.

name: Palermo View Studio at Palermo Uno Tower
description:
Modern studio apartment on the 19th floor with amazing views of the city.
Building with 24 hours security, pool, laundry and gym on the 31st floor.

The space
Palermo View is a cut above in more ways than one, lifting you up out of the city to the 19th floor of Palermo Uno the latest addition to the Buenos Aires skyline. Wake up every day to views across fashionable Palermo and beyond.
The studio has been carefully designed and decorated to give a sense of freshness and light, with subtle colour's making it the perfect retreat after a long day or night exploring this vibrant city. The 35 sq meters Studio offers a comfortable living space with a Queen bed, lounge area with cream leather sofa, also equipped with a full entertainment system, Flat Screen TV, DVD and Cable, sound system WiFi.

To make the best of the view the studio is designed with an ample separate kitchen opening up on to a private balcony perfect for preparing sun down cocktai
neighborhood_overview: If you’re an expat or vacationer spending time in Buenos Aires there’s really no way of avoiding Buenos Aires’ largest barrio (by area), Palermo. Even if you live somewhere else in the city you can guarantee that the vast majority of your expat friends, and probably a good part of your Argentine friends, will live there, and even if they don’t you’ll still want to go there to dine, party and shop.
host_about: Although a German national, I have  actually resided outside of my native country for almost half my life. My first ventured abroad to Greece where I  worked in guest relations at a premier hotel in Athens. From there I moved to Sydney, Australia where he held an post as personal assistant to a major politician within the Australian Parliament. Soon, with a desire to be more independent, I followed my instincts and in Sydney I opened, managed and ultimately sold, two very successful natural food and juice bars. It was then, in 2007, When I decided to return to a place which I had visited some years before---BUENOS AIRES, ARGENTINA---and now, it is the place I call home!

Ideal for those who want to enjoy the classic pedestrian of Buenos Aires, since they are a few steps from Lavalle, on the corner with Esmeralda, and close to Florida, where you can enjoy live shows, selling crafts and their eternal activity.
The location of this apartment is ideal for people who visit Buenos Aires, whether for work, if they want to go shopping or enjoy all the entertainment and fun offered by the traditional avenues and pedestrians that surround them. Close to subway and bus li
host_about: Hola, soy Maritza, vivo en Buenos Aires, en la zona de Recoleta.  Algo que me gusta mucho es viajar y, felizmente, he tenido la oportunidad de hacerlo en muchas ocasiones.  Sé lo que un viajero espera y desea al llegar a hospedarse en otro país, por este motivo trato que los pasajeros que se hospedan en los tres departamentos que alquilo, reciban el confort y el trato que a mí me gusta recibir.  Ante todo,  van a encontrar al llegar a uno de los departamentos que alquilo un trato personalizado, todas las comodidades que puedan necesitar, confortabilidad, limpieza (que es muy importante) y recibir toda la ayuda que yo les pueda brindar.

description:
Studio apt on front of the 4th floor with balcony. In the heart of Palermo Hollywood.

The space
Excellent and safe location for your stay in Buenos Aires in the heart of the Palermo Hollywood neighborhood.

Near line D subway station and multiple other means of public transport. Next to restaurants, trendy area.

Furnished and equipped, new 33,5 square meters apt with parking space. Doble bed, living room, kitchen, bathroom, A/C and WiFi.
neighborhood_overview: Palermo Holly is all about wining and dining as opposed to sightseeing. But for something different, what about a spot of tango, Palermo H is the home to the well known milonga Practica X (Humboldt 1464). This milonga is notable for the fact that its patrons are overwhelmingly non-Argentine, which might be a good or bad thing depending on what you are looking for. Check their web site for exact details. Visit the Mercado de Pulgas (Niceto Vega y Dorrego), you won't see many tourists at this covered market, which sells second-hand (or more accurately 4th or 5th-hand) furniture. Its rabbits' warren of stalls are fun to poke around and offer a glimpse of the city's opulent past, open 10am to 5pm.
host_about: Doc film making, fly-fishing, horse and bicycle riding, and some other activities, both out and indoors.

Viviana

neighborhood_overview:
DONDE VIVI. house.
10 mts from Plaza Almagro. (Park)
2 blocks from La Catedral. (Milonga Tango Dancing)

1 block from Av. Medrano.
3 blocks from Av Corrientes.
3 blocks from Av. Rivadavia.

The only problem is the street noise... the busses in the city are noise and all over !!! some of them sound a bit like trucks... so if you don't have problems to sleep it will be fine!
host_about:
I am easy going, tango person, some times i go out during the week, and I rest on weekends and some times I like to mix. I love to dance, I like to fix things! chat with friends! I enjoy my job, dancing and teaching Tango to people from different cultures! And , Claro, I like to travel! :)

I like my neighborhood Almagro because there are Tango bars, to listen singers, others to listen Tango groups,  some are for Dance Tango, and I just walk to them! I like the Park at the corner and that is still an authentic "Barrio Porteño" (local people area).

My house is a bit artistic-gitano place, is one floor up by stairs, it has two rooms in the front, with a living room in between the rooms. In the middle is a little dinning room comunicating to the kitchen, bathroom, patio and a hallway to the back of the house, to the "Vivi's cave". 
I enjoy my little Patio and my plants! I like very much to stay in contact with people from all over the planet! ( I did live in New York city for 7 years so I am use to it). I Speak Spanish, English, and a bit of Italian, just a bit. I am a happy person, most of the time, i have good humor most of the time too!!!
Come and visit me!
Chaaaaaaau!
Viviana

host_about:
Hi, I'm Luciano and I'm Argentinian. I was born in Patagonia, but I came to live in this beautiful city many years ago to study at the university. I’ve also lived abroad –in Amsterdam- and travelled all around the world: needless to say…I love to travel.   
I have many passions: sports —running, hikking, tennis and -of course- soccer—, languages, tango and music; literature and cinema. I have friends from many countries and I enjoy hosting and showing them around, as I do with our guests whenever I have the chance.  My family and I offer several apartments in the best parts of town. We have been renting them for more than 16 years! We were one of the first ones in BA to join Airbnb back in 2010. It has been an amazing experience to be part of this comunity and we have had the chance to welcome people from all over the globe. 

Let me know if I can help you with your plans in la Reina del Plata, you are going to love Buenos Aires...

The neigbourhood is safe, lively and famous for its tango and theatre performances, historic cafeterias, and restauran
neighborhood_overview:
Boedo is one of the most antique, safe and traditional neighborhoods of Buenos Aires. Boedo is well known for its tango related history, Milongas (Tango dancing nightclubs), poets, and old cafes, bars.

Although the neighborhood has recently been renewed a special effort has been put to preserve its original charm.

Here the first independent theaters were founded, and in the still running cafes the famous ¨grupo de Boedo¨ - a collective of well known intellectuals and artists of the time - began their gatherings.

The apartments are located only 500 meters from the Underground that will take you to the Plaza de Mayo (main square), Puerto Madero or San Telmo in a few minutes. You may also choose traveling by bus since all the major bus routes pass through Boedo.
host_about:
I am architect, interested in arts, especially painting.
I love chocolate, Aki Kaurismaki movies, early mornings, photography...

I was trying to decorate our apartments nicely so that your stay would be more pleasant. I am recommending my guests places to visit, things to do. I was traveling around the world some years ago and I understand how stressful it is to look for a place to stay, to orientate in a new city. 

I normally paint all day in my studio so I am quick to respond e-mails. 
Looking forward to hearing from you, 

Egle

Recoleta es un barrio para disfrutar y cuando abres la ventana por primera vez parece volver el tiempo atrás al observar su arquitectura francesa y sus calles quietas y arboladas.
host_about:
IG SpeakRentBA  Rentas Temporarias
Es un placer compartir con mis huéspedes el placer de viajar conocer y compartir . Nuevos lugares , sus costumbres, su gente , siempre es una experiencia enriquecedora. Viajar es uno de mis mayores placeres !

Compartimos los valores de Airbnb , somos respetuosos de nuestros huéspedes, de las similitudes y de las diferencias. Nos gusta compartir con ellos e integrarlos a nuestra cultura. Me hace sentir feliz que se sientan como en casa, por eso siempre les piso que la cuiden como si fuera suya !

Soy mama de Jonás de 12  y Gael de 9 y crezco junto a ellos en esta emocionante aventura de ser mamá ! 

Espero que pasen hermosos días en esta ciudad y que vuelvan y recorran mas ciudades de nuestro país. 

Te esperamos ! Disfrutarás tu estadía en nuestro lugar y descubrirás una ciudad asombrosa !

#Belong Anywhere

name: Loft in Palermo Hollywood.Pool 617
description:
Modern one bedroom loft in Palermo Hollywood 6th floor. Large swimming pool, garden, gym, 24/7 doorman and laundry.Equipped kitchen, fast reliable wifi internet. One block from subway station. Restaurants,supermarkets and bars in the area.

The space
Modern loft on the sixth floor of a modern building.
Paraguay & Arevalo streets, Palermo.
Decorated with a minimalistic style and new furniture. The apartment has two-story windows on what would be the far wall. These windows let in lots of light and a magnificent view of the green gardens below.
Large windows with excellent blinds. These blinds prevent daylight to get into the apartment if guests want to sleep in darkness.
On the first floor there are a living room, an open american style kitche, a toilette (powder room) and a balcony with chairs and table where one can enjoy breakfast or even a meal.
Attention: you can see a washing machine in the small bathroom, that is no longer there.
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is located in Palermo, more precisely in Palermo Hollywood, which got its modern nickname after some of the major TV and radio studios moved there but is best known for its nightlife, which includes some of the best restaurants, bar and clubs in the city. Another sub-area of Palermo – Palermo Soho – is very near the apartment, just crossing Av. Juan B. Justo and it is the fashion epicenter of BA. Palermo is a quiet, mostly residential neighborhood. There are no much offices apart from the design and software firms that are principally located in the area. It is also the area for modern and stylist furniture stores.
host_about:
I'm an economist, 47 years old. I enjoy spending time with visitors to learn about their cultures and also to practice foreign languages.i studied in the USA and lived a few years in Europe, having settled back in Argentina two years ago.
My favorite hobby is travelling around the world!

name: LEMON TREE ★ 1 bedroom with great views
description:
Set at the back of the modern Santa Fe Plaza building, in this one-bedroom apartment on the 13th floor you'll be close enough to the action on lively Santa Fe Avenue, yet shielded from the noise of the city below.

The space
In this great one-bedroom apartment in Barrio Norte / Recoleta lots of light floods into the spacious living room from the sizeable balcony with wonderful views over the city. Set at the back of this modern apartment building, you are close enough to the action on lively Santa Fe Avenue, yet shielded from the noise of the city below.

The fully fitted and modern American open plan kitchen looks onto the large living area, which features a comfortable L shape couch and dining table with four chairs. The other side of the apartment features a stand alone bedroom area with a double bed and full equipped bathroom. The apartment also has cable TV, a stereo, two air conditioning units, Wi-Fi internet and a security safe for your valuables
neighborhood_overview: Located on the famous Santa Fe Avenue, with its quality shopping and abundance of bars, cafe and restaurants, and one block from the subway station Pueyrredon of the D Line, this apartment is in the ideal place for you to make the most of your Argentine experience.
host_about: Although a German national, I have  actually resided outside of my native country for almost half my life. My first ventured abroad to Greece where I  worked in guest relations at a premier hotel in Athens. From there I moved to Sydney, Australia where he held an post as personal assistant to a major politician within the Australian Parliament. Soon, with a desire to be more independent, I followed my instincts and in Sydney I opened, managed and ultimately sold, two very successful natural food and juice bars. It was then, in 2007, When I decided to return to a place which I had visited some years before---BUENOS AIRES, ARGENTINA---and now, it is the place I call home!

name: Depto de 1 ambiente en Recoleta
description:
The space
Este agradable y luminoso departamento esta ubicado en uno de los barrios más exclusivos, de Buenos Aires, entre Recoleta y Barrio Norte, en el medio de toda la "movida porteña". Se encuentra a una cuadra de la Avenida Santa Fé y dos cuadras de la estación del Subterráneo Línea D Estación Callao.
Ubicación óptima tanto para turismo como para estudiantes. Aquí encontrarás el tango callejero de primer nivel, restaurantes al aire libre para disgustar la mejor carne del mundo. A solo cuadras podrás recorrer la Avenida Corriente con sus múltiples librerías, centros culturales, tanguerías y teatros. Sobre la Avenida Santa Fé encontrarás cines, confiterías, tiendas de alta costura, espectaculares diseños de zapatos y cuadras de vitrinas para deleitar cualquier amante de la ultima moda.
También encontraras el famoso Cementerio de Recoleta donde no debes dejar de visitar el Mausoleo de Evita Peron y la Librería Ateneo situada en la antigua Casa de Opera.

neighborhood_overview:
Boedo is one of the most antique, safe and traditional neighborhoods of Buenos Aires. Boedo is well known for its tango related history, Milongas (Tango dancing nightclubs), poets, and old cafes, bars.

Although the neighborhood has recently been renewed a special effort has been put to preserve its original charm.

Here the first independent theaters were founded, and in the still running cafes the famous ¨grupo de Boedo¨ - a collective of well known intellectuals and artists of the time - began their gatherings.
host_about:
I am architect, interested in arts, especially painting.
I love chocolate, Aki Kaurismaki movies, early mornings, photography...

I was trying to decorate our apartments nicely so that your stay would be more pleasant. I am recommending my guests places to visit, things to do. I was traveling around the world some years ago and I understand how stressful it is to look for a place to stay, to orientate in a new city. 

I normally paint all day in my studio so I am quick to respond e-mails. 
Looking forward to hearing from you, 

Egle

neighborhood_overview: San Telmo is one of the best neighborhoods in the city of Buenos Aires, and the way to find out is living a few days in, enjoying its picturesque streets, taking a coffee in one of its notable bars or dining at any of the innumerable restaurants . Visit art galleries, going to museums, explore the Sunday antiques fair on Defensa, or play in a milonga tango dance watching local and why not learn a few steps. Also the weekend has lots of fun. I know many places to eat or get out, but do not recommend them because as long as you walk in my neighborhood I feel like newcomer, I think San Telmo always new things to discover secretly.

name: Charming studio in Palermo/Recoleta
description:
Comfortable and bright studio apartment in the Palermo/Recoleta neighborhood of Buenos Aires, two minutes away from Agüero metro station.

The space
Comfortable and bright studio apartment in modernized 1940s building is available for short/long stay in the Palermo/Recoleta neighborhood of Buenos Aires, two minutes away from Agüero metro station and Santa Fe Avenue, connecting with both the center of town and the heart of Palermo.
The apartment is on the 4th floor, facing Gallo Street. It is fully furnished, including a well-equipped kitchen with microwave and oven, a bathroom with shower and bath, a queen-size bed, abundant closet space, air conditioner/heating, a flat screen TV, cable, and wireless internet.
The apartment has original features such as parquet floors and high-ceilings. There is also a balcony with seating space ideal for drinking mate or a glass of Malbec in the afternoon.
Bed linen and towels are provided.

About th
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located right on the border between hip Palermo and elegant Recoleta, with excellent transport links.
There is a great bakery two doors down, various supermarkets nearby, and an excellent grocery store with fresh veg and fruit round the corner. Lots of cafés, both old and new are available in the area, as well as traditional parrillas and modern gourmet restaurants.

name: French Classic in San Telmo: Balcony over Defensa!
description:
This refined two-bedroom apartment is in an elegant turn-of-the-century building that housed the elite of San Telmo/Monserrat during Argentina’s heyday. You can tell it was built for the wealthy when you step into the lobby. Gorgeous staircase and birdcage elevator with stained glass windows, heavy wrought-iron door, and beautiful mosaic tiles.

The space
In the heart of the San Telmo antique area and a few blocks from the famous Plaza Dorrego tango square, this historic French building features a 95 Square Meter, third floor 2 Bedroom/2 Bath apartment with a designer's blend of the avant garde and antiques.

Buenos Aires has a large network of buses, locally called "Colectivos". There are 144 lines, each one identified with a number and different colors. The ticket is paid on the bus with a card called SUBE. There is one in the apt for guests use, which you only need to charge with credit.

The subway system is very reliable and it covers th
neighborhood_overview: It's a fantastic location. We love San Telmo's bohemian vibe and authenticity. Though gentrification is definitely happening, it's not pretentious... yet. You'll want to explore San Telmo's casas de tango, small traditional restaurants known as bodegones, old-fashioned bars called Nares notables, antique and vintage shops, and the trendy new restaurants, cafes, and fancy boutiques. Day or night, San Telmo is full of activity. In particular, we love that it's small. No matter where you are in San Telmo, you'll find a cool place to eat, great bars and cafes, some lovely boutiques (though fewer than in Palermo or Recoleta) and you will mostly hear Spanish.
host_about: I'm Grisel and I'm from Buenos Aires, Argentina. I'm an English teacher who loves travelling, loves being in contact with people from different parts of the world and enjoys the city of Buenos Aires, especially the vibrant and hip neighborhood of San Telmo.

name: The Boss- 2 bedroom with balcony
description:
The space
This luxury 4th Floor 2 bedroom and 2 bathroom apartment in the Palermo Uno high-rise building will dazzle you with style and light.
Palermo Uno is a new “Resort Style” concept in urban vacation apartment rentals with a splendid 20 metre outdoor pool and sun deck, expansive gardens, plus a large 31st floor gymnasium with state-of-the-art exercise equipment affording spectacular city and river views while you workout. The top floor spa includes separate mens and ladies saunas and massage rooms.. Located close to public transit amidst the trendy Palermo restaurants, boutiques, cafes, bars, and convenience stores it is the perfect place to enjoy everything that Buenos Aires---The Paris of South America---has to offer the discerning visitor.
A lower-level laundry facility will save you from over-packing and excess baggage charges. The 24 hour security personnel and the BA4Uapartments staff ensure that your stay at Palermo Uno is safe, enjoyable, and defin
neighborhood_overview: If you’re an expat or vacationer spending time in Buenos Aires there’s really no way of avoiding Buenos Aires’ largest barrio (by area), Palermo. Even if you live somewhere else in the city you can guarantee that the vast majority of your expat friends, and probably a good part of your Argentine friends, will live there, and even if they don’t you’ll still want to go there to dine, party and shop.
host_about: Although a German national, I have  actually resided outside of my native country for almost half my life. My first ventured abroad to Greece where I  worked in guest relations at a premier hotel in Athens. From there I moved to Sydney, Australia where he held an post as personal assistant to a major politician within the Australian Parliament. Soon, with a desire to be more independent, I followed my instincts and in Sydney I opened, managed and ultimately sold, two very successful natural food and juice bars. It was then, in 2007, When I decided to return to a place which I had visited some years before---BUENOS AIRES, ARGENTINA---and now, it is the place I call home!

This classic French-style apartment is located on a quiet, tree-lined street one block away from the Plaza Intendente Alvear and the famous Recoleta Cemetery. Upscale shops, restaurants both grand and intimate, and a walker's paradise are just outside your door. Recoleta is considered one of the more affluent and safe neighborhoods in BA - historic and filled with architectural gems. Also a fantastic location to take in the daytime cafe scene or the more lively after dark nightlife.

The space
This classic French-style apartment is located on a quiet, tree-lined street but yet is just one block away from the Plaza Intendente Alvear, which faces the famous Recoleta Cemetery and Recoleta Cultural Center. Just around the corner is the classic luxe hotel, the Alvear Palace Hotel, and other posh hotels and shopping venues are all within a stone's throw. Upscale shops, restaurants both grand and intimate, and a walker's paradise are just outside your door. Recoleta

PALERMO along with Recoleta is the safest and most upscale neighborhood in Buenos Aires. It is filled with trendy bars, restaurants and design shops.

***ENG BELOW***

Mi pasión es la cerámica pero también me gusta el arte contemporáneo en todas sus facetas. Podrán ver algunas de mis obras durante su estadía en mi casa.

Soy una persona curiosa y me apasiona todo. Me encanta probar cosas nuevas, nuevos sabores y nuevos destinos de viaje con entusiasmo y mente abierta.

Guest
neighborhood_overview: San Telmo is one of the best neighborhoods in the city of Buenos Aires, and the way to find out is living a few days in, enjoying its picturesque streets, taking a coffee in one of its notable bars or dining at any of the innumerable restaurants . Visit art galleries, going to museums, explore the Sunday antiques fair on Defensa, or play in a milonga tango dance watching local and why not learn a few steps. Also the weekend has lots of fun. I know many places to eat or get out, but do not recommend them because as long as you walk in my neighborhood I feel like newcomer, I think San Telmo always new things to discover secretly.

name: Luxury Premier Loft with Breathtaking Views  ★★★★★
description:
Amazing Loft/duplex apartment on the 25th floor with amazing views over Palermo Soho.
Building with 24 hours security, pool, laundry ,sauna ,sky gym on the 31st floor.

The space
This amazing 25th Floor, two storey, luxury Loft in the distinctive Palermo Uno high-rise apartment building will dazzle you with style and light. With the floor to ceiling six metre windows, the city of Buenos Aires stretches out beneath you with views of Palermo Hollywood, Palermo Soho. And at night---relaxing on a queen-sized bed in the upper level loft---you will feel as though you are floating on your very own magic carpet under the stars. The ultra-modern black tiled floors, silver trim, and modern furnishings complete the bright and airy experience of living up in the clouds. Rounding out the perfect space is a main floor power room plus spacious second level full bathroom with window and city view.
Palermo Uno is a new “Resort Style” concept in urban vacation apartment
neighborhood_overview: If you’re an expat or vacationer spending time in Buenos Aires there’s really no way of avoiding Buenos Aires’ largest barrio (by area), Palermo. Even if you live somewhere else in the city you can guarantee that the vast majority of your expat friends, and probably a good part of your Argentine friends, will live there, and even if they don’t you’ll still want to go there to dine, party and shop.
host_about: Although a German national, I have  actually resided outside of my native country for almost half my life. My first ventured abroad to Greece where I  worked in guest relations at a premier hotel in Athens. From there I moved to Sydney, Australia where he held an post as personal assistant to a major politician within the Australian Parliament. Soon, with a desire to be more independent, I followed my instincts and in Sydney I opened, managed and ultimately sold, two very successful natural food and juice bars. It was then, in 2007, When I decided to return to a place which I had visited some years before---BUENOS AIRES, ARGENTINA---and now, it is the place I call home!

neighborhood_overview: The area known as Plaza San Martín or Retiro, is one of several historical districts of Buenos Aires city. The European and rich architecture of this neighborhood gives Plaza San Martín a distinguished style. The fabulous palaces built in its vicinity mostly belonged to aristocratic families that settled there in the late 1800 when the yellow fever epidemic struck in Buenos Aires. The Plaza is located at the beginning of Florida Street, the most famous pedestrian street in the city of Buenos Aires, where you can find Galerías Pacífico, a mall remodeled from the offices of Argentine railways and that nowadays is one of the most exclusive shopping centers in Buenos Aires. The opulent European architecture of this neighborhood gives Plaza San Martín a distinguished style. • Price includes weekly cleaning and linen change

The space
The style of this beautiful studio is understated elegance. Greys and whites are the main colour schemes, with a few bright splashes here and there. A lot of thought has been put in adding extra details and amenities to make your stay very comfortable. There is great photography artwork on the walls, a full-wall mirror, a safety deposit box, black-out blinds, a comfortable sofa with lots of pillows, high thread count linen, and all the comforts you would expect in a boutique
neighborhood_overview:
Palermo Soho is THE place to be in Buenos Aires, with its tree-lined cobbled streets, village-feel, charming old buildings, trendy bars and restaurants and a multitude of shops. Five minutes’ walk and you are in Palermo Hollywood, another fabulous area to discover, with very trendy and gourmet restaurants.

Most expats and tourists, but also locals, love to live and stay in the Palermo Soho neighbourhood. Even if you stay elsewhere, you will definitely want to come to the area again and again for dinner, drinks and shopping, so treat yourself by staying right in the middle of it all.
host_about: Although a German national, I have  actually resided outside of my native country for almost half my life. My first ventured abroad to Greece where I  worked in guest relations at a premier hotel in Athens. From there I moved to Sydney, Australia where he held an post as personal assistant to a major politician within the Australian Parliament. Soon, with a desire to be more independent, I followed my instincts and in Sydney I opened, managed and ultimately sold, two very successful natural food and juice bars. It was then, in 2007, When I decided to return to a place which I had visited some years before---BUENOS AIRES, ARGENTINA---and now, it is the place I call home!

Pool View apartment is ideally situated. This neighborhood is close to the city´s largest parkland including the Botanical Gardens, the Japinese Garden, the Rose Garden, the Zoo Garden, and Palermo lakes. Palermo is renowned for some of the hottest gay bars, restaurants, nightlife, and shopping boutiques along cobbled streets lined with trees and historic architecture buildings. Close to the Subte/Metro station and city bus routes, this Studio is the perfect place to call home as you explore the many diverse regions of this dazzling metropolis.

host_about:
Hi! And thank you for your interest in our property. I'm fluent and comfortable speaking English and Spanish. I manage temporary rentals here in Buenos Aires and also in Mar del Plata, with my brother-in-law Dave, who used to be an expat in BA but is now back in the US running rentals there, our collaborator Sam, who is a freelance journalist originally from England but based in BA for a number of years now, and our collaborator Adriana in Mar del Plata. 

We've been doing this since 2011 with great results, particulary with regards to the satisfaction that our guests have expressed in their reviews and kind words to us. I believe our apartments are excellent and we strive to provide a delightful experience for everyone staying at them.

I'm passionate about engineering, science, history, art, cooking and sports, and enjoy meeting our guests to introduce them to our lovely city.

Como digo arriba, también hablamos español. Para resumir lo dicho en inglés, soy de Buenos Aires y, junto con mi cuñado y otros colaboradores, administramos alquileres temporarios desde 2011 en Buenos Aires y Mar del Plata. Los comentarios de nuestros muchos huéspedes han sido excelentes, y es un placer presentarles nuestras lindas ciudades mientras nos aseguramos de que su estadía sea bien placentera.

host_about:
Hola soy Magdalena!!  y te ofrezco mi casa para  que pases una estadía maravillosa  Soy Licenciada en Artes .Tengo dos hijos hermosos,  Ana y Santiago que ya están realizando su propia experiencia de vida y tres mascotas Lola (mi perra) y Tita (la gata) y catalina (la tortuga) a los que adoro.

Serás bienvenido!!!

name: Recoleta great penthouse  w/private terrace &grill
description:
In the heart of the Recoleta District, the most elegant and extremely safe neighbourhood, you find this quiet and magic spot.
Four bedrooms each with its AC unit and private bathroom en-suite; amazing living room, dining room for 14 guests, a very well equipped kitchen make of this a great intimate place where to spend holidays in Buenos Aires when travelling with a group.
We can provide food service, breakfast, lunch, dinner, Asados at the terrace.
Pets and children are very welcome.

The space
El apartamento tiene cuatro habitaciones, cada una con un baño privado y aire acondicionado. El cuarto principal cuenta con una cama tamaño king. Las otras dos habitaciones cuentan con camas tamaño queen, y la última habitación tiene 3 camas individuales. En caso de necesitar camas extras, el espacio de la biblioteca cuenta con un sofá con 2 colchones individuales.

El living es amplio y luminoso, con muchos detalles artísticos y una tele de 40”
neighborhood_overview:
Recoleta es agradable, elegante, seguro y limpio. Cuenta con un perfecto equilibrio de las unidades residenciales y tiendas. Este barrio es considerado uno de los más elegantes y seguro de Buenos Aires.

Este apartamento se encuentra ubicado en el corazón del distrito Recoleta, segura y elegante, llena de tiendas, restaurantes y muy cerca de los museos y puntos de interés turístico.

Recoleta es un área próspera, conocida por sus townhouses estilo París, antiguos palacios opulentos y boutiques de lujo. El Cementerio de la Recoleta es una de las atracciones principales, ya que alberga las tumbas extravagantes de íconos nacionales como Eva Perón. En el Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes, se exhiben obras maestras, mientras que en el Centro Cultural Recoleta se ofrecen eventos temporales de vanguardia. En la Plaza Francia, cubierta de césped, se lleva a cabo un mercado de artesanías durante los fines de semana.

Los 10 mejores lugares para visitar en La Recoleta
host_about:
I am an absolute Buenos Aires lover, I really adore my city and most of all the Recoleta district where I was born. Mother of four, started this hosting business in 2004 when my third child was four years old and about to start school all day long. The prospect of a lot of spare time made me look out for something to do that could be compatible with raising kids, so here I am hosting travelers in my spot in the world, sharing all my tips and secrets. Buenos Aires, Recoleta.  I hope you enjoy your stay!

Ximena Tezanos Pinto

The space
Small duplex loft in a beautiful and big antique house of more than a centuryyears old.The apartment has been re designed combining modern with antique.

Located in the heart of San Telmo, 2 blocks away from Defensa street,where you can find many bars, restaurants, art galeries and antique shops.6 blocks from Puerto Madero, the Ecological Reserve and Plaza Dorrego. 5 blocks from Florida street and Plaza de Mayo, where begining all the subways.

The Loft have a comfortable living room with a sofa, table and chairs. The kitchen is fully equiped with refrigerator, oven,microwave and complete service.

neighborhood_overview: San Telmo is one of the best neighborhoods in the city of Buenos Aires, and the way to find out is living a few days in, enjoying its picturesque streets, taking a coffee in one of its notable bars or dining at any of the innumerable restaurants . Visit art galleries, going to museums, explore the Sunday antiques fair on Defensa, or play in a milonga tango dance watching local and why not learn a few steps. Also the weekend has lots of fun. I know many places to eat or get out, but do not recommend them because as long as you walk in my neighborhood I feel like newcomer, I think San Telmo always new things to discover secretly.

host_about:
My family is from the United States; I was born and raised in Buenos Aires, but went to an American school in the northern suburbs of Buenos Aires. This was the single best experience I could ever have had, as I grew up learning fluent English, as well as growing up with people from all walks of life and different parts of the world. I started out in the world of real estate in 1996, and ever since I’ve been working to one degree or another in real estate, management, and brokerage consultancy. Time and experience drew me away from a legal profession altogether, and I became a realtor, specializing in advising foreigners seeking to invest in Argentine real estate.
We have a collection of apartment rentals, ranging from studios to three-bedroom units, located all around the main areas of influence of the beautiful city of Buenos Aires. Our units come fully-equipped with everything from bedding and linens, to kitchen utensils. All details have been taken care of, so that while our clients are visiting Buenos Aires, the apartment rental becomes a home away from home.

host_about:
Hi, I'm Luciano and I'm Argentinian. I was born in Patagonia, but I came to live in this beautiful city many years ago to study at the university. I’ve also lived abroad –in Amsterdam- and travelled all around the world: needless to say…I love to travel.   
I have many passions: sports —running, hikking, tennis and -of course- soccer—, languages, tango and music; literature and cinema. I have friends from many countries and I enjoy hosting and showing them around, as I do with our guests whenever I have the chance.  My family and I offer several apartments in the best parts of town. We have been renting them for more than 16 years! We were one of the first ones in BA to join Airbnb back in 2010. It has been an amazing experience to be part of this comunity and we have had the chance to welcome people from all over the globe. 

Let me know if I can help you with your plans in la Reina del Plata, you are going to love Buenos Aires...

neighborhood_overview: If you’re an expat or vacationer spending time in Buenos Aires there’s really no way of avoiding Buenos Aires’ largest barrio (by area), Palermo. host_about: Although a German national, I have  actually resided outside of my native country for almost half my life. My first ventured abroad to Greece where I  worked in guest relations at a premier hotel in Athens. From there I moved to Sydney, Australia where he held an post as personal assistant to a major politician within the Australian Parliament. Soon, with a desire to be more independent, I followed my instincts and in Sydney I opened, managed and ultimately sold, two very successful natural food and juice bars. It was then, in 2007, When I decided to return to a place which I had visited some years before---BUENOS AIRES, ARGENTINA---and now, it is the place I call home!

neighborhood_overview:
Our 2 apartments are located in one of the safest and most elegant neighborhoods of Buenos Aires, the renowned Recoleta. Famous for its prosperous upper class, is an elegant residential area where the chic restaurants, cafes and boutique shops abound amid the cultural epicenter of the capital of Argentina.

Buenos Aires, Always in Style...
"Paris, which I've come to think of as the Buenos Aires of Europe"
"There's a high beauty quotient among the people of Argentina, and they dress with flair. Even women in jeans have that ability to throw on an ordinary scarf or shawl in such a way that they end up looking elegant."
Buenos Aires will sweep you off your feet.

neighborhood_overview:
Boasting museums, cultural centers and historical landmarks, the beauty of Recoleta is that as a tourist you can find something of interest on any given day of the week. The standout highlight is the Recoleta Cemetery. Attached to the cemetery is the brilliant-white church of Nuestra Señora del Pilar, which symbolizes the heart of the barrio.

If you are in the mood for culture, then at the Centro Cultural Recoleta you can enjoy art displays, concerts, theatrical performances, workshops and festivals, such as BAFICI, dedicated to independent cinema. Recoleta is also home to the magnificent Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes, displaying work by Goya and Rembrandt and offering free entrance from Tuesday to Sunday, and the funky-looking Biblioteca Nacional.

Plaza Francia is a popular weekend spot for bohemian types and every Saturday and Sunday hosts the artisan market Feria de Artesanos de Plaza Francia.

host_about:
My family is from the United States; I was born and raised in Buenos Aires, but went to an American school in the northern suburbs of Buenos Aires. This was the single best experience I could ever have had, as I grew up learning fluent English, as well as growing up with people from all walks of life and different parts of the world. I started out in the world of real estate in 1996, and ever since I’ve been working to one degree or another in real estate, management, and brokerage consultancy. Time and experience drew me away from a legal profession altogether, and I became a realtor, specializing in advising foreigners seeking to invest in Argentine real estate.
We have a collection of apartment rentals, ranging from studios to three-bedroom units, located all around the main areas of influence of the beautiful city of Buenos Aires. Our units come fully-equipped with everything from bedding and linens, to kitchen utensils. All details have been taken care of, so that while our clients are visiting Buenos Aires, the apartment rental becomes a home away from home.

description:
Luminous & modern apartment located in the trendy Cañitas neighborhood. The first floor has a living and dining room area, a kitchen, a guest bedroom and 1/2 bathroom. Upstairs there's a master bedroom with king size bed, complete bathroom.

The space
Clean, confortable and spacious duplex. Air conditioning only in living room and second bedroom (downstairs). Upstairs there is a fan. Heating in every room.
Equiped kitchen and one complete bathroom. The second bathroom doesnt have a shower.

Guest access
- WI FI - Cable TV - Telephone with locall calls included.

- Towels and linens included

- Safe box - Iron - Hairdryer

Para estadías de más de 8 noches te brindaremos un juego extra de sábanas y dos juegos extra de toallas (solo si son dos huésp
neighborhood_overview:
Within one block is a grocery store, laundry and wine shop. Expanding out within a 5 block radius are many fun boutiques, a high-end shopping mall (El Solar de la Abadia), and tons of delicious restaurants.

One of the nicest parts of Palermo. Hundreds of restaurants, bars, cafe’s. One block from Libertador Av, 3 blocks from the parks (Bosques de Palermo), 20 minute walk from SoHo, plaza Serrano, perfect for shopping. Most hot-spots are within walking distance. Otherwise public transportation and buses nearby, and cabs are right outside the door.
host_about:
Hola! Te invito a ver los apartamentos que manejamos!

Sentite libre de preguntarnos lo que necesites acerca de los apartamentos y sobre Buenos Aires. Podemos sugerirte restaurantes, shows y lugares para conocer en Buenos Aires.

Nuestro principal objetivo es brindar un hogar lindo, limpio y donde todo funcione perfectamente. Durante tu estadía estaremos en contacto para lo que necesites a través de los mails y el teléfono.

Disfruten su estadía!!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Hi! I invite you to see the apartments we have listed!

Feel free to ask any questions, about the apartments and about Buenos Aires. We can suggest restaurants, shows and spots in Buenos Aires.

Our main concern is to provide a nice, clean and fully working home to our guests. We are fully reachable during your stay for any concerns.

Enjoy your stay!!

description:
Cómodo studio para 4 personas. A pasos del metro. A 10/15 minutos del centro de la ciudad y los principales puntos de interés.Muchas líneas de bus y rodeado de negocios.Gran centro comercial sobre Av. Corrientes.Seguridad las 24Hs

The space
Moderno e impecable departamento tipo loft. Superficie 60 m2 - Ubicado en el corazón de Palermo Queen, rodeado de numerosos bares y restaurantes. A. 3 cuadras de la Calle Aguirre donde están todos los OUTLET de las primeras marcas, muy frecuentada por los turistas- a media cuadra del subte “B” El edificio es nuevo cuenta con piscina y se accede a un amplio jardín muy soleado y aireado. El Dpto posee un confortable living comedor con grandes ventanales con balcón terraza que da al pulmón de la piscina, muy luminoso, con aire acondicionado frio/calor. Cocina integrada y totalmente equipada con heladera con freezer, anafe, microondas, cafetera, tostadora, juguera eléctrica, vajilla para 6 personas . Camas para 4
neighborhood_overview:
El departamento se encuentra a metros de Av. Corrientes alli se encuentra la línea de metro B estación Malabia. En 15 minutos se encontrará en pleno centro de la ciudad de Buenos Aires para acceder a Plaza de Mayo, San Telmo, Puerto Madero y otras conecciones.
A 10 minutos caminando se encontrará en pleno corazón de Palermo.
Sobre Av. Corrientes tendrá todo lo que necesite porque hay muchísimos negocios.

name: Gorgeous Apartment-Best Location
description:
Right in the center of everything on the most artsy street in Buenos Aires. Walk to Puetro Madero, Casa Rosa and Wake up on Sundays to the Art Fair of San Telmo that begins at the front door of this historic and gorgeous apartment building.

The space
Location Location Location - Just 2 blocks from Plaza de Mayo on Defensa. This 2 bedroom apartment sleeps 4 and is is situated inside a renovated Antique French building. This apartment has lots of original French stain glass leaded windows and doors, Original parqued floors, claw footed Porcelain bathtub,Vaulted ceilings and expensive French chandeliers and furniture. It is also next door to several Tango shows, Hola Espanol Spanish School, and sits at the beginning of the famous San Telmo Faire held each Sunday. Walk less than 2 blocks and you are facing Casa Rosa (The presidential House) and Florida Street (Famous Shopping Avenue with all the leather shops). All the main subway and bus lines run to Plaza de
neighborhood_overview: The apartment is on the first block on defensa.  This is the street where the famous weekly Sunday art fair is located.  It's also the street where all the tango clubs, art galleries, and funky restaurants.  It is a very safe part of Buenos Aires and to be more centrally located would be nearly impossible.
host_about: I’m a contemporary art gallery owner currently residing in Florida with my Argentine husband and two children. We frequent Argentina to find amazing artists.

The space
Located near the Palermo Soho neighborhood —considered to be the most vibrant and exciting area of Buenos Aires — this ultra luxury apartment is just blocks from the Botanical Gardens, and Palermo Zoo. It is spacious with over 430 sq. feet (40 sq. meters). The apartment gets plenty of sunlight throughout the day due to it’s superior location on the 21st floor of the building. The view of the city both day and night is breathtaking with unobstructed views of the City and skyline.





The apartment is in an upscale brand new building recently completed in September 2009. The building features 24 hours per day/ 7 days per week security guards, 5 modern elevators, pool and gym*. It is one of the most upscale buildings in Palermo. The gym* is located on
host_about:
Hi, I'm Luciano and I'm Argentinian. I was born in Patagonia, but I came to live in this beautiful city many years ago to study at the university. I’ve also lived abroad –in Amsterdam- and travelled all around the world: needless to say…I love to travel.   
I have many passions: sports —running, hikking, tennis and -of course- soccer—, languages, tango and music; literature and cinema. I have friends from many countries and I enjoy hosting and showing them around, as I do with our guests whenever I have the chance.  My family and I offer several apartments in the best parts of town. We have been renting them for more than 16 years! We were one of the first ones in BA to join Airbnb back in 2010. It has been an amazing experience to be part of this comunity and we have had the chance to welcome people from all over the globe. 

Let me know if I can help you with your plans in la Reina del Plata, you are going to love Buenos Aires...

Moderno y luminoso departamento de un ambiente, idealmente ubicado en Recoleta, muy próximo a las avenidas Las Heras y Pueyrredón. Cerca a mucho medios de transporte, 2 líneas de subte (D y H). Edificio moderno con pileta!

The space
Modern Studio placed in one of the most elegant and traditional areas of Buenos Aires, Recoleta. Some of the most traditional touristic sites like the Recoleta Cemetery, the National Museum of Fine Arts, Plaza Francia and many of Buenos Aires most traditional cafés are located in this área. The metro station and a lot of buses lines are a few blocks away. The apartment is located between two of the most traditional avenues in the city: Las Heras and Santa Fe.

The studio is modern design & very sunny. It has one queen size bed and a sofa that can be used as a single bed. It is equipped with Smart TV, high- speed Internet WI-FI connection, oven, refrigerator, microwave, coffee machine and air conditioning. The kitchen is ful
neighborhood_overview: Recoleta es el barrio céntrico más seguro y elegante de Buenos Aires. Concentra un gran número de atractivo para los visitantes entre los que se encuentran el famoso cementerio y el Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes. Además muchos parques y plazas dominan el barrio entre las cuales se encuentran la Plaza Francia.

description:
Lovely apartment only 1 block from Palermo University. It´s a traditional neighborhood of Buenos Aires, sourrended by theaters, bars and long tradition of tango. In the heart of Buenos Aires, well connected with everything by Metro and Buses.

The space
Very comfortable apartment in Palermo, 2 blocks from Universidad de Palermo, 4 blocks from subway line C. The neighborhood is quite but well conected, only 2 blocks around you will find coffes, bars, restaurants, theaters, supermarkets, etc.

The apartment is luminous and it´s located in 5th floor with balcony to a quiet street. It is fully equipped, it has a LCD TV 32´ with cable, Internet, air conditioning cold/hot, iron, microwave over and coffe maker. The building has also public washing maching for your clothes. In the last floor there is a swimming pool with public access.

If you plan to stay longer than 3 months, let me know to arrange a special price.
neighborhood_overview: Es un típico barrio porteño, clásico, bohemio y tanguero. En pocas cuadras hay muchos teatros bares y restaurantes de todo tipo. No hay que caminar más de dos cuadras para encontrar comercios de todo tipo, supermercados, panaderias, carnicerías y verdulerías. Se encuentra muy cerca del Abasto, uno de los lugares con más traición tanguera de Buenos Aires.

name: Room @ soapmaker / best location in BA
description:
Double room with private bathroom in an 1920's apartment where my handmade soap workshop works, part of the "Simplemente Jabón" entrepreneurship.
The place smells wonderful and is usually very quiet. Some days I sleep here and some days I don't. Sometimes my cat Fernández is there, a little panther soft as velvet and eager to play.
The kitchen is very spacious and shared!

The space
The apartment is a classic 1920's, renovated by me. It has a lot of natural light and peace due to its location in the quiet part of the building without adjoining buildings.
It is strategically located on Avenida Corrientes, so it is very safe to enter at any time.
It is on the first floor in the heart of Almagro, surrounded by theaters, bars, restaurants, milongas, cinema, etc. So you can usually do everything on foot.
It's also easy to take public transportation to anywhere.

Guest access
The apartment is accessed through an open corrid
neighborhood_overview:
Almagro, the theater district of Buenos Aires, has a lot to investigate. Tango places, Bars, Restaurants, Shopping Abasto, Konex Cultural Center, "La Catedral del Tango", art galleries, studios, and much more.
It is located strategically to get everywhere easily by bus, subway, taxi or bike. It is safe to come and go all day, and there are plenty of shops and supermarkets all arround, still keeping the "neighbour" feeling.
host_about:
Born and grown up in Buenos Aires, travelled quite a lot arround and even worked at hostels and tourism while studding hystory and photography. Now i choose this country to develop myself and to try build the world i believe in. 
Professional photographer, studing second carrier at the National University of Arts in Buenos Aires (theater and stage light design). Working most of all in theater and teaching photography, also renting a room at my own house, wich is an old classic home from 1910 redesigned fully in 2011.

description:

It is on the 15th floor of one of the towers in a 2 tower complex. It also has a shared gym, laundry room, video/tv room, internet room, spa, changing rooms, game room and a pool on the 27th floor. It is in a perfect location because it is between two avenues, Luis Maria Campos and Santa Fe, so there are lots of buses and subte and train station very close, and is walking distance from the shops and bars in Las Cañitas and next to "Distrito Arcos" new shopping mall. It also has an excellent view, as you can see the Rio de La Plata.

The space
Welcome to Mi Casa en BA:

Mi Casa en BA is a typical "porteña" house built in 1906 , we fully renovated it to raise our family there. It´s located in Balvanera, a traditional neighborhood of Buenos Aires, inspiration of one of Borges poems. We offer five rooms, for one, two or up to three people, two of them with private bathroom and three others with a shared bathroom.
For more than 7 years Mi Casa en BA has been hosting travelers, students and foreign tourists from all over the world, many of them have lived in the house for months, making the
neighborhood_overview:
Neighbourhood Highlights:

Among the architectural features in Balvanera are the eclectic style Congress building and the statue group in neighboring Plaza Congreso. The El Molino tea room is located across the street in a building that has seen several rounds of restoration since its heyday that continue to the present time.

The café Los Angelitos in the corner of Rivadavia and Rincón was a meeting point for poets and musicians. It features a relief of angels in its façade, which is one of the landmarks of the barrio. After extensive restorations, it was reopened in 2007, now it offers live tango shows and it has become a tourist landmark much like the Café Tortoni and Confitería La Ideal.
Tango lovers will find that they can reach the best traditional "milongas" at few blocks distance.
host_about:
Hi, my wife Josefina and I, Juan, will be your hosts. There will always be one of us to welcome you, solve your problems and make your stay pleasant and comfortable.
I’m an architect and I personally restored and decorated the house with the help of the whole family, my wife Josefina and our three sons. There is a part of each of us in every room, because we developed the family and the house at the same time. So, we are inviting you to our place and hope you will feel at home during your stay in BA. 
Our eldest son, Ignacio, started the project “Mi Casa en BA” back in 2011. He lived in the house and made it a home for visitors from all walks of life. He also has the credit for making us superhosts with Airbnb, status we have kept throughout the years.
A bit about our family: Josefina is an English teacher, Ignacio is a crossfit coach who is now living in Sweden, Hernán is a graphic designer and Nicolás is a cook. 
We love our city and we can help you get to know the city and its people, the Porteños.
If you have any questions or would like to know more about us, please don't hesitate to send us a message. 
We’re looking forward to welcoming you as our guests!

neighborhood_overview: If you’re an expat or vacationer spending time in Buenos Aires there’s really no way of avoiding Buenos Aires’ largest barrio (by area), Palermo. Even if you live somewhere else in the city you can guarantee that the vast majority of your expat friends, and probably a good part of your Argentine friends, will live there, and even if they don’t you’ll still want to go there to dine, party and shop.
host_about: Although a German national, I have  actually resided outside of my native country for almost half my life. My first ventured abroad to Greece where I  worked in guest relations at a premier hotel in Athens. From there I moved to Sydney, Australia where he held an post as personal assistant to a major politician within the Australian Parliament. Soon, with a desire to be more independent, I followed my instincts and in Sydney I opened, managed and ultimately sold, two very successful natural food and juice bars. It was then, in 2007, When I decided to return to a place which I had visited some years before---BUENOS AIRES, ARGENTINA---and now, it is the place I call home!

neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is located just 2 blocks from the Campo Argentino Polo in the Palermo neighborhood. Within the neighborhood of Palermo is "Las Cañitas", an area of ​​modern buildings, lofts and tree-lined streets. It concentrates one of the main gastronomic centers of Buenos Aires. Very Trendy

Happy hours, dinners, Argentine food (grills), international food, fusion food, Asian, Mediterranean, etc., define it as the new gourmet neighborhood of the city. Meeting place par excellence with options for all tastes and ages.

The special thing about Las Cañitas is that during the day it still maintains its air of a quiet and residential neighborhood. Just a few minutes walk from the Palermo Parks - such as the Rosedal - the city's first green lung where all kinds of sports and recreational activities take place on weekends.
host_about:
Welcome!!!
My name is Laura, and I'm part Argentinian and part Spaniard. 

Please follow us on (Hidden by Airbnb) @DWELLAWAY and keep in touch!!

I love to travel and meet new people and to experience different cultures, foods and customs.

I have a Business Degree, having worked in International Commerce for multinational companies. 

I founded my company  @DWELLAWAY,  more than 10 years ago, my short term rental company.

I have lived NYC, Houston, and Miami and visited different cities in America and Europe.

After renting apartments in various cities, I have acquired a knowledge for the specific needs and preferences of renters / travelers.

My team and I strive to make sure that we offer guests a warm and welcoming feeling  as if they were in their own homes.

Our goal is to provide high quality service and solutions through dedication and excellence.

I hope you enjoy your stay!
See you soon!
Laura
…………………………………………………………………………………………………

Hola! Bienvenidos!!!

Soy Laura, Española y Argentina.   

Mi pasión es viajar y conocer personas de distintas culturas y ciudades.  

Soy Licenciada en Administración de Empresas, trabaje en Comercio Internacional en  multinacionales, vivi en NYC, Houston, Miami y otras.  

Desde hace más de 10 años soy la fundadora de  mi empresa, #DWELLAWAY, dedicada a  alquileres temporarios. 

Luego de vivir y alquilar apartamentos en distintas ciudades,  descubrí las necesidades y preferencias de los huéspedes. 

Me encanta viajar y visitar cada una de las propiedades que ofrezco para mejorar la calidad y calidez, busco la excelencia para que mis huéspedes se sientan como en casa y no les falte nada.

Gracias! 
Nos vemos pronto!
Laura.

name: charming and fresh old style studio
description:
The space
In a 1920 building by Argentinean architect Augusto Plou —graduate from L’Ecole des Beaux Arts de Paris in 1882- in a very nice corner of downtown Buenos Aires area, this charming apartment is fully equipped for 2/3 people.

It is a very luminous one bedroom apartment with 2 balconies, one bathroom and a small but well equipped kitchen, with gas and electric oven, and a refrigerator with freezer. The living room has air conditioning and a fan, gas stove, TV, Wi-Fi connection and CD player.

A 2 x1,5 mt darkroom for photography purposes is available.
Warmly decorated, furnished with old style furniture, beautiful paintings by local artist Rolando Sá that feature Tango and other local themes, this apartment for temporary rent in BA is very well located in Balvanera, a centric neighborhood where you can find renowned bookshops open 24/7, theatres, banks, restaurants and cinema equipment stores.

neighborhood_overview:
Boedo is one of the most antique, safe and traditional neighborhoods of Buenos Aires. Boedo is well known for its tango related history, Milongas (Tango dancing nightclubs), poets, and old cafes, bars.

Although the neighborhood has recently been renewed a special effort has been put to preserve its original charm.

Here the first independent theaters were founded, and in the still running cafes the famous ¨grupo de Boedo¨ - a collective of well known intellectuals and artists of the time - began their gatherings.
host_about:
I am architect, interested in arts, especially painting.
I love chocolate, Aki Kaurismaki movies, early mornings, photography...

I was trying to decorate our apartments nicely so that your stay would be more pleasant. I am recommending my guests places to visit, things to do. I was traveling around the world some years ago and I understand how stressful it is to look for a place to stay, to orientate in a new city. 

I normally paint all day in my studio so I am quick to respond e-mails. 
Looking forward to hearing from you, 

Egle

name: In the heart of Palermo, Soho Point
description:
The space
Effort and love are the two words that inspired me to create the Soho Point back in 2009. This fully equipped studio condominium is formed by 6 spacious and bright units and is located in the heart of Palermo Soho, one of the coolest places in Buenos Aires.
My experienced in travelling away from home made me want to create a space where guests could feel warm, just like home. This is how I got the idea of building this special and unique place in Buenos Aires.
The Soho Point is not a hotel, but it’s not just an apartment. Soho Point is a new concept in tourism where you are always welcome without feeling stuck in a rigid structure. You will be able to manage your schedule and activities, but at the same time you will always find someone willing to give you some advice, guide you in the city or even help you with any problem that can come up at any time.
The Soho Point is in the middle of a popular area so you will find people in the streets 24/7
host_about: I'm a young entrepreneur who enjoys the pleasures of life. As a lawyer, artist, writer, scuba dive Instructor, snowboarder, I am driven by my curiosity and restless spirit that took me all around the world, to experience the cordiality and fellowship of many other cultures, that led me to venture into the lodging business, focused in hospitality and premium services; based on my own experiences and all the common expectations that people like me experienced when we are thrown into the adventure of traveling.

name: Studio in Buenos Aires
description:
The space
Studio located on Callao Avenue one block from Corrientes. Variety of means of transport. Two subway lines at 150 and 250 meters. Two blocks from the National Congress and eight from the Obelisk.

Taxis in Buenos Aires are black with the roof painted yellow, they roam the city streets 24 hours a day and you can either flag them on the streets or call them for a pick up (Radio Taxis).

Buenos Aires has a large network of buses, locally called "Colectivos". There are 144 lines, each one identified with a number and different colors.

The subway system is very reliable and it covers the center and the outskirts of the city with a combined route of 46 kilometers and 80 stations.

Controlled access - 24 hour security. Window with city view - balcony to the street. Air conditioning - Central heating. Kitchenette - Refrigerator - Microwave oven. Large bathroom - Bath. Large closet. Cable TV. Phone - Wi-Fi. Safe. Crock

Tranquil residential neighbourhood, which offers a wonderful mix of classic porteño cafés, restaurants, live music venues, against a backdrop of contemporary interior decor, flea markets and green spaces.

The space

The apartment features wooden floors, double size bed, double sofa bed, single sofa bed, integrated kitchen with all mod cons (oven, microwave,fridge, freezer, coffeemaker, toaster,...), washing machine, big storage space, linen and towels.

neighborhood_overview:
Colegiales cobbles together pieces of Porteño tradition with modern amusements. This strikingly tranquil residential neighbourhood embraces BA's long-withstanding cafe culture but sets it against the backdrop of contemporary interior decor. Flea markets and multi-story murals attract vintage urbanists while manicured gardens and wrought iron balconies offer peaceful respites from the more hurried paces of neighbouring Belgrano and Palermo.
When venturing deep into the back streets of Colegiales you will be treated to a wonderful mix of classic porteño cafés, closed-door restaurants and live music venues.

neighborhood_overview:
Boedo is one of the most antique, safe and traditional neighborhoods of Buenos Aires. Boedo is well known for its tango related history, Milongas (Tango dancing nightclubs), poets, and old cafes, bars.

Although the neighborhood has recently been renewed a special effort has been put to preserve its original charm.

Here the first independent theaters were founded, and in the still running cafes the famous ¨grupo de Boedo¨ - a collective of well known intellectuals and artists of the time - began their gatherings.

host_about: Although a German national, I have  actually resided outside of my native country for almost half my life. My first ventured abroad to Greece where I  worked in guest relations at a premier hotel in Athens. From there I moved to Sydney, Australia where he held an post as personal assistant to a major politician within the Australian Parliament. Soon, with a desire to be more independent, I followed my instincts and in Sydney I opened, managed and ultimately sold, two very successful natural food and juice bars. It was then, in 2007, When I decided to return to a place which I had visited some years before---BUENOS AIRES, ARGENTINA---and now, it is the place I call home!

neighborhood_overview:
Buenos Aires, Always in Style... Then is Recoleta !!
One of the safest and most elegant neighborhoods of Buenos Aires. Famous for its prosperous upper class, is an elegant residential area where the chic restaurants, cafes and boutique shops abound amid the cultural epicenter of the capital of Argentina.

"Paris, which I've come to think of as the Buenos Aires of Europe"
"There's a high beauty quotient among the people of Argentina, and they dress with flair. Even women in jeans have that ability to throw on an ordinary scarf or shawl in such a way that they end up looking elegant."
Buenos Aires will sweep you off your feet.
This world-famous city is a fusion of cultures and cuisines. From antique fairs to tango, there's always something exciting happening at every turn.
host_about:
I am a passionate owner of two beautiful apartments in Recoleta, one of the most elegant and famous neighborhood in Buenos Aires.
 For the past seven years, I've being committed and dedicated to make sure that our guests enjoy the "home away from home feeling" . Everything about the studio apartments is special. The facilities, decoration plus pool, gym, sauna amenenities.

 By making myself available in case they have questions or needs I make sure to offer the best at our two locations-

 I'm in love with my beautiful city and this elegant and renown Recoleta neighborhood. Buenos Aires,

 For more than 35 years I was the owner of a New York Travel and Tours Wholesale business dedicated to the most important destinations in South and Central America. And now as much as then, I continue to provide the same dedication to assure that my guests enjoy these lovely apartments.

The NY Times wrote:
 Always in Style--- "Paris, which I've come to think of as the Buenos Aires of Europe"--

name: Experiencia Recoleta-Buenos Aires
description:
The space
Departamento de 3 ambientes en 7º piso al frente, con balcón corrido. Consta de 2 dormitorios (uno con cama queen y el otro con dos camas twin), ambos con placard de pared a pared, un living comedor grande, cocina separada y baño completo con bañera y ducha.
La cocina cuenta con: cocina con horno, heladera con freezer, horno microondas, juguera, tostadora y cafetera eléctricas, amplias alacenas, pequeño desayunador con dos banquetas, vajilla completa para 4 personas, ollas y demás utensilios de cocina.
El living comedor tiene una mesa extensible para hasta 6 personas, cuatro sillas, un sillón de dos cuerpos, un sillón individual, mesa ratona, una biblioteca, lámparas, un mueble componible para tv, y un mueble rinconero.
Todos los pisos, con excepción del baño, son de madera, y posee equipos de aire acondicionado frío/calor en el living-comedor y dormitorio principal además de calefacción central en invierno en todos los ambientes.
Elemento
neighborhood_overview:
El barrio es muy residencial, con dos supermercados cerca. El Parque Las Heras, uno de los mas lindos y amplios de la ciudad, está muy cerca de la propiedad, así como también el Ecoparque y el Jardín Botánico.
Dentro del área se encuentra el Cementerio de la Recoleta, icono de Buenos Aires, y el Centro Cultural Recoleta, con espectáculos, talleres y actividades culturales permanentes. También el Museo Evita y el de Arte Decorativo, además del Museo Nacional de Bellas Artes.
host_about: Soy una persona a la que le gusta mucho leer, viajar y disfrutar tiempo con amigos. También amo la música, soy bastante ecléctica y escucho desde música clásica hasta música típica de otros países, además del de mi país,  ya que me interesan mucho las culturas diferentes a la mía. Estudié un tiempo Antropología en la Universidad de Buenos Aires, y tuve la suerte de poder viajar bastante cuando era más joven, creo que la experiencia de viajar es invalorable y ayuda a hacer un mejor mundo para todos. También me encanta la fotografía, estudié con un gran fotógrafo, pero lo hago de manera amateur. Actualmente vivo en Adrogué, un suburbio de la provincia de Buenos Aires, tranquilo y arbolado, donde Jorge Luis Borges pasó muchas etapas de su vida, y al cual le dedicó un poema (Adrogue). Estoy casada y tengo dos hijos, de 21 y 18 años, que siguen mis pasos, son viajeros apasionados. No soy una experta, pero puedo comunicarme bastante bien en inglés y en italiano.

description:
The space
Spacious 1-bedroom luxury non-smoking apartment located in the Recoleta/Barrio Norte area of Buenos Aires. This is a desirable largely residential area, close to the center and just one block from the subway line. It has a quiet bedroom with a large queen-sized bed and lots of closet-space, plus a full-sized futon in the living room for guests for a third (and possibly a fourth) person.

There are two air-conditioners in the apartment but there is also a nice breeze and two ceiling fans for those who prefer natural breeze. The apartment has been totally renovated with all modern fixtures but with as many of the original touches such as the wood floors and iron hardware retained to preserve the period feel.

The location is simply excellent. A full-service laundry is literally across the street (5 m away) and has same-day or next-day service. A dry-cleaner is at the corner (20 m away), as is an excellent wine shop, and a full grocery store i
