host_about:
Hola a todos!

Soy Argentina nací en Posadas Misiones, norte de mi País, con muchas experiencias vividas, siempre me gusto aprender de otras culturas, he sido muy viajera, me considero sociable, me gusta estar entre gente, es unos de los motivos del porque ofrezco mi departamento en Buenos Aires, para huéspedes de todas partes del mundo, me preocupo para que se encuentren cómodos en mi casa y me ofrezco ayudarlos en todo lo que necesiten!
He tenido mi Estudio de danza temático de Tango, en Buenos Aires del 2006 al 2011, después de haber vivido en Europa la mayor parte en Suiza, mas de 20 años, vengo de familia reconocida en el ambiente del tango.
Personalmente me gusta la fotografía, he expuesto en varias ocasiones en Buenos Aires
Entre otros intereses me gusta bailar y no solo el Tango, luego esta la cocina, reuniones en familia, amigos, el teatro y la decoración en lo clasico.

Tengo alma de exploradora, disfruto de la naturaleza, como el campo, montar a caballo, caminar por las montañas, océanos, navegar en velero, Bicicleta, etc, etc,.
Simplemente quería acercarme a ustedes con esta pequeña descripción de mi misma, para que se sientan confiados en el momento de elegir mi casa para su estadía en Argentina, Buenos Aires!

host_about:
Soy Ilana y vivo en Buenos Aires.
Me dedico a cuidar y rentar varios apartamentos en el Barrio de Palermo.
Buenos Aires es una hermosa ciudad y Palermo es el más lindo barrio para pasear, mirar tiendas de diseño, comer algo distinto o sentarse en una calle arbolada a tomar un café. Lo que más me gusta de Palermo es su tranquilidad y su onda, y las ferias que se arman en plazas y calles los fines de semana. Es la zona ideal para vivir Buenos Aires!

neighborhood_overview:
Palermo es sin lugar a dudas uno de los barrios más bonitos para alojarse en BA, y este apartamento en particular, tiene una ubicación privilegiada. Se encuentra sobre una calle empedrada y arbolada, en una zona residencial.
A pocos metros empiezan a aparecer las cafeterías y tiendas de diseño que caracterizan al barrio.
Tenemos cerca las plazas conocidas como Placita Serrano y Plaza Armenia, epicentro de ferias artesanales los fines de semana.
Hacia el otro lado, nos encontramos con Plaza Italia, el Jardín Botánico y el Predio Ferial La Rural, donde se llevan a cabo las exposiciones más importantes.
Para los amantes del deporte y la vida al aire libre, dando unos pasos más, encontrarán con los Bosques de Palermo, que con más de 80 hectáreas, es uno de los más grandes espacios verdes de Buenos Aires.
Vas a sentirte un vecino más del barrio, haciendo las compras en el supermercado, saliendo a correr, sentándote a tomar un café o una cerveza en cualquier bar, y u
host_about:
Soy Ilana y vivo en Buenos Aires.
Me dedico a cuidar y rentar varios apartamentos en el Barrio de Palermo.
Buenos Aires es una hermosa ciudad y Palermo es el más lindo barrio para pasear, mirar tiendas de diseño, comer algo distinto o sentarse en una calle arbolada a tomar un café. Lo que más me gusta de Palermo es su tranquilidad y su onda, y las ferias que se arman en plazas y calles los fines de semana. Es la zona ideal para vivir Buenos Aires!

You know you have something special when your g
neighborhood_overview:
Designed by Argentine fashion impresario Alan Faena and Philippe Starck in 2004: Faena Hotel+Universe in Buenos Aires, Argentina - Creating a "universe" of Opulence & Fantasy,
and what a universe it is. The facilities just about live up to the billing, comprising not just the must-haves (two restaurants, spa and swimming pool, complete with poolside bar) but some delightful extras as well, including an art gallery ‘School of Good Living' offers classes on dance, cooking and wine, and the red velvet Cabaret is an old-fashioned music hall straight out of a David Lynch picture.The Bistro is more typically Starck, in Kubrickian white with red accents and unicorn heads mounted on the walls, serving an international cuisine with plenty of that storied Argentine beef. If you wish to venture outside the Universe to one of Puerto Madero's many hot restaurants and nightspots, just call your Experience Manager (we used to call them concierges) for a comprehensive list of recommendations.

Guest reservations are available for weekly, short term or longer term stays.

host_about:
Thanks for considering my place to enjoy a wordeful time at buenos Aires.I live in the city since I borned, more than 30 years ago.
I love travelling so I love the experience to host people at my apartaments. I m not an agency (thats that manage a lot of apartments). Each apartment is mine.
I have travelled around the world: Usa, Germany, Hong Kong, Thailand, France, Check Rep, Spain, Mexico, Chile, Cuba and more!  From all this places I have to say that Buenos Aires is one of the most amazings cities in the entire world.
I m an apasionate "porteño" (person that lives in Buenos Aires). I also love music and movie (Website hidden by Airbnb) big of Martin Scorsese ´s and Alex de la Iglesia films)
Here you may find the best restaurants, argentinians or food from all over the world (india, china, brazil, spain, italian, japan and more).
Tango music and dance will catch you, and you may fall in this passion...
I ll do my best as a host, to give you an incredible experience in our city
I m a person that love and enjoy to work 
I speak english, spanish, portuguese, some french and italian!!!
When you came to my places, I will give you some special tips for your trip! There are some important advices that you may know when you come to Argentina
My places always are sunny, with good furniture. I m a honest and responsable owner.
Let me know you too !!!

Gracias por considerar mis apartamentos como un lugar para vivir en tu estadía en Buenos Aires, ciudad en la que vivo desde que nací , hace más de 30 años.
Amo viajar, por lo que amo hospedar gente en mi ciudad, ya que conozco muy bien lo que es ser "turista".
Estuve en muchísimos lugares: Alemania, Estados Unidos, Francia, Hong Kong, España, Italia, Mexico, Cuba y muchos más
Soy propietario de mis espacios, no soy una agencia que regentea miles de lugares.
Soy un apasionado de mi ciudad y quiero compartirla con ustedes.
En Buenos Aires podrán encontrar miles de restaurantes, tanto argentinos como de otros países (india, brazil, Italia, España, entre otros)
Otra cosa que me encanta de aquí, es el tango. Se siente en cada rincón de la ciudad, de los barrios.
Soy un trabajador incansable, y amo lo que hago.
Me encanta la música y el cine, soy fanático de las películas de Martin Scorsese y Alex de la Iglesia
Hablo Inglés, español, portugés, francés y un poco de italiano!!
Cuando viajes a la Argentina te daré unos consejos muy importantes para quien visita nuestro país.
Mis lugares siempre son luminosos, con buen mobiliario.
Soy un host responsable y honesto
Espero conocerte y que me cuentes más sobre tus historias

name: PRIVATE BEDROOM SINGLE BED
description:
Super comfy private room, full of light. Make yourself at home, enjoy the peace and quiet with all the design and comfort of a unique place located near the City center. We have five different rooms in our house , you can check them all clicking on the host icon.

The space
Welcome to Mi Casa en BA:

Mi Casa en BA is a renovated colonial style house in Balvanera, a traditional neighborhood of Buenos Aires.

For more than 7 years Mi Casa en BA has been hosting travelers, students and foreign tourists from all over the world, many of them have lived in the house for months, making their stay a unique experience.

About this room:

This is a large room with Single bed, high ceilings and antique style desk. The room also connects to one of the patios of the house. It has a lot of natural light.
Shared bathroom.

My other publications:

Visit our other listings, this house has 4 different types of rooms w
neighborhood_overview:
Neighbourhood Highlights:

Among the architectural features in Balvanera are the neo-classical Congress building and the statue group in neighboring Plaza Congreso. The El Molino tea room is located across the street in a building that has seen several rounds of restoration since its heyday.

The café Los Angelitos in the corner of Rivadavia and Rincón was a meeting point for poets and musicians. It features a relief of angels in its façade, which is one of the landmarks of the barrio. After extensive restorations, it was reopened in 2007, now it offers live tango shows and it has become a tourist landmark much like the Café Tortoni and Confitería La Ideal.
host_about:
Hi, my wife Josefina and I, Juan, will be your hosts. There will always be one of us to welcome you, solve your problems and make your stay pleasant and comfortable.
I’m an architect and I personally restored and decorated the house with the help of the whole family, my wife Josefina and our three sons. There is a part of each of us in every room, because we developed the family and the house at the same time. So, we are inviting you to our place and hope you will feel at home during your stay in BA. 
Our eldest son, Ignacio, started the project “Mi Casa en BA” back in 2011. He lived in the house and made it a home for visitors from all walks of life. He also has the credit for making us superhosts with Airbnb, status we have kept throughout the years.
A bit about our family: Josefina is an English teacher, Ignacio is a crossfit coach who is now living in Sweden, Hernán is a graphic designer and Nicolás is a cook. 
We love our city and we can help you get to know the city and its people, the Porteños.
If you have any questions or would like to know more about us, please don't hesitate to send us a message. 
We’re looking forward to welcoming you as our guests!

The space
This Sunny Duplex Apartment is located Downtown Buenos Aires, next to all main tourist attractions. It was once owned by Bioy Casares and Silvina Ocampo, both famous Argentine writers. The building has its own history... Alberto Prebisch one of the main Rationalist Argentine Architects, a men ahead of his times(author of "El Obelisco" and "El Gran Rex" theather between others) constructed this building for Victoria Ocampo, a famous altruist aristocrat of those days, in late 1930s. Now the apartment has been completely recycled and refurbished with disign furniture for your confort . The café Los Angelitos in the corner of Rivadavia and Rincón was a meeting point for poets and musicians. It features a relief of angels in its façade, which is one of the landmarks of the barrio. host_about:
Hi, I'm Luciano and I'm Argentinian. I was born in Patagonia, but I came to live in this beautiful city many years ago to study at the university. I’ve also lived abroad –in Amsterdam- and travelled all around the world: needless to say…I love to travel.   
I have many passions: sports —running, hikking, tennis and -of course- soccer—, languages, tango and music; literature and cinema. I have friends from many countries and I enjoy hosting and showing them around, as I do with our guests whenever I have the chance.  My family and I offer several apartments in the best parts of town. We have been renting them for more than 16 years! We were one of the first ones in BA to join Airbnb back in 2010. It has been an amazing experience to be part of this comunity and we have had the chance to welcome people from all over the globe. 

Let me know if I can help you with your plans in la Reina del Plata, you are going to love Buenos Aires...

I have travelled around the world: Usa, Germany, Hong Kong, Thailand, France, Check Rep, Spain, Mexico, Chile, Cuba and more!  From all this places I have to say that Buenos Aires is one of the most amazings cities in the entire world.
I m an apasionate "porteño" (person that lives in Buenos Aires). I also love music and movie (Website hidden by Airbnb) big of Martin Scorsese ´s and Alex de la Iglesia films)
Here you may find the best restaurants, argentinians or food from all over the world (india, china, brazil, spain, italian, japan and more).
Tango music and dance will catch you, and you may fall in this passion...
I ll do my best as a host, to give you an incredible experience in our city
I m a person that love and enjoy to work 
I speak english, spanish, portuguese, some french and italian!!!
When you came to my places, I will give you some special tips for your trip! There are some important advices that you may know when you come to Argentina
My places always are sunny, with good furniture. I m a honest and responsable owner.
Let me know you too !!!

Gracias por considerar mis apartamentos como un lugar para vivir en tu estadía en Buenos Aires, ciudad en la que vivo desde que nací , hace más de 30 años.
Amo viajar, por lo que amo hospedar gente en mi ciudad, ya que conozco muy bien lo que es ser "turista".
Estuve en muchísimos lugares: Alemania, Estados Unidos, Francia, Hong Kong, España, Italia, Mexico, Cuba y muchos más
Soy propietario de mis espacios, no soy una agencia que regentea miles de lugares.
Soy un apasionado de mi ciudad y quiero compartirla con ustedes.
En Buenos Aires podrán encontrar miles de restaurantes, tanto argentinos como de otros países (india, brazil, Italia, España, entre otros)
Otra cosa que me encanta de aquí, es el tango. Se siente en cada rincón de la ciudad, de los barrios.
Soy un trabajador incansable, y amo lo que hago.
Me encanta la música y el cine, soy fanático de las películas de Martin Scorsese y Alex de la Iglesia
Hablo Inglés, español, portugés, francés y un poco de italiano!!
Cuando viajes a la Argentina te daré unos consejos muy importantes para quien visita nuestro país.
Mis lugares siempre son luminosos, con buen mobiliario.
Soy un host responsable y honesto
Espero conocerte y que me cuentes más sobre tus historias

Lovely family

The space
Looking for a perfect destination for a perfect getaway? You don’t need to go far; Buenos Aires is the perfect place to go. This place is perfect if you want a superb and unforgettable escapade, this Argentinian metropolis has a lot of thing to offer.

Taxis in Buenos Aires are black with the roof painted yellow, they roam the city streets 24 hours a day and you can either flag them on the streets or call them for a pick up (Radio Taxis).

Buenos Aires has a large network of buses, locally called "Colectivos". There are 144 lines, each one identified with a number and different colors.

The subway system is very reliable and it covers the center and the outskir

name: Studio privado, en el centro.
description:
Oasis en el medio de la ciudad de Buenos Aires, departamento antiguo de techos muy altos, amueblado con una hermosa cama antigua, los muebles mantienen el estilo. Tranquilidad, para inspirarse, para dormir....

The space
La casa está situada en la zona comercial de Balvanera, a pocas cuadras del Congreso de la Ciudad de Buenos Aires y de la histórica Avenida de Mayo, con sus antiguos bares y sabor porteño.
La casa es antigua, reciclada por dentro y separada en departamentos independientes , cada uno de ellos con su baño y cocina. Estan equipados con cama doble, heladera, horno a gas, internet wi-fi, TV y ventilador.
Ofrecemos sábanas y toallas, las cuales cambiamos semanalmente sin costo adicional.
Ideal para una persona o una pareja.
En la casa viven varias personas muy simpáticas, pero cada una tiene su espacio privado, por lo cual el contacto es sólo por opción.
El departamento no es adecuado para fumadores.
Las zonas a compartir
neighborhood_overview:
Balvanera es uno de esos barrios que poca gente sabe dónde empieza y dónde termina. De los más grandes de Buenos Aires y tiene dentro tres barrios que en realidad no existen. Sí: la gente llama “Once” (por la estación de tren 11 de Septiembre) a un barrio que en realidad no se llama Once, sino Balvanera. Y hacen lo mismo con Congreso, que tampoco existe como barrio porteño sino que es parte de Balvanera. Y adivinen qué: Abasto tampoco existe: es parte de nuestra querida Balvanera.

Barrio de historia enorme y muchas veces trágica: ahí vivió Gardel, ahí se asentó la comunidad judía más grande de Argentina; existió el emblemático Cromagñon y la AMIA.
Balvanera tiene un detalle hermoso: está lleno de pasajes. Varios favoritos para quien escribe esta nota.

Así que… acá te dejamos 7 cosas para hacer si vivís o cruzás Balvanera. (Y una buena yapa al final de otras cositas…)


Qué hacer y qué ver en el barrio de Balvanera?

Conocer por

host_about:
We’re Base.casa ,a friendly Argentine company with several move-in-ready apartments in the lovely Buenos Aires. With homes in vibrant, centrally based neighborhoods, you’ll feel in the comfort of your home and free to roam for as long as you want. – a day, a month, a year or who knows, maybe longer.

Each of our rentals is thoughtfully designed with fully equipped kitchens, exclusive furnishing and in some apartment’s incredible amenities – making every day a ten-starts experience. From day one, you’ll enjoy high-speed internet, premium linens, and smart entertainment.  Plus, in some of our apartments, gyms, access to pools and more.

Why stress over your staying? We provide a hassle-free alternative — a consistent, quality guest experience that starts even before you arrive. Because we let you book our most up-to-date apartment listings online, confirm with a click, pay securely, and check in easily, thanks to Airbnb platform.

During your stay
Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Base.casa team member or given self-check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours! You’ll enjoy reliable support via (Hidden by Airbnb) , Airbnb message system, and our phone, where you can request everything from a home cleaning to extra towels.

We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

name: Unique home in Palermo Hollywood.
description:
The space
Large spaces from top to bottom in this unique three-story property. Large living space downstairs with fully equipped kitchen, living room with projector and screen, large library with tons of titles (mostly in English) and a fireplace. On the second floor: there are three bedrooms, and two bathrroms (one on suite) around an outdoor patio with lots of water plants. The third floor includes a Pool (yes, a pool!) and barbecue area on the roof with a great city view. Terrace has a very private feel with no high rises nearby looing over the terrace. Internet, Wifi, cable TV, washer and dryer, dishwasher. Daily maid service (2 hours) at no extra charge. We are located a block from Oui Oui, The Food Factory and a dozen other small cafes in Palermo Hollywood. No buses run on our street and it is a residential area just a few of blocks from main avenues Santa Fe and Cabildo (four blocks from the Carranza subway station). Check out the house's blog with lots of photos

The space

<
neighborhood_overview: I love the neighborhood.  It has a charming mix of old  houses and modern buildings that are not higher than 10 stories (they do not allow towers in the area to take care of the landscape). It is beautiful to walk the arround and suddenly find a small place to have coffee. There are great restaurants, bars and delis to discover.
host_about:
I love travelling around the world and opening my mind to new people and new cultures and I enjoy as much being a host in my beautiful country. I am a professional in the tourism and hospitality industry. A few years ago I decided to quit my job and become independent and I am loving it!!!
In Buenos Aires, there is magic in the air, come and feel it  :)

Bus-Metro-Metrobus-Train-bikes, all 4 min walk. #sunny #fully-eqquiped #greaterrace #spacework #palermo-hollywood #buenosaires #trendy #wine-bars #restos #cafes #art #tango#fashion-shops

The space
This beautiful apartment is at the heart of one of the most charming neighborhoods of Buenos Aires. The Palermo Hollywood area is well-known for its varied and multi-cultural night life and cuisine.

The apartment (80 m2) is on the seventh floor (with elevator) and has a large balcony filled with plants with a wonderful view of the neighborhood. On warm nights it is the perfect place to relax and have a drink!
It is completely furnished, includi
neighborhood_overview:
It's only 200 meters away from the bars and restaurants of Palermo, designer stores, art galleries, specialized bookstores and music stores.

If you like Tango, close by you will find numerous "milongas" - La Viruta, Villa Mallcom, the Fundación Tango Argentino, and the Salón Canning, with its characteristic wooden floor and elegant dancers. For dining, there are great places nearby where it's possible to eat the marvelous argentinian steak, sushi, ethnic food, pizzas, cuisine française, italian, mexican food, etc. There is something for every taste!

As if all this were not enough, for those who love the great outdoors, near the apartment are also the Palermo Woods, the largest "green lung" of Buenos Aires...
host_about:
Hi, my name is Gabi. I work as press agent for artists. I rent my pretty department in Buenos Aires because I will travel to France for a while. I love traveling, meeting people from around the world with other cultures, the outdoors, the sea, the sun, music, films, theater, and enjoy life with family and friends. I love freedom but I think it should be exercised with great respect for each other, so that's what I expect from someone who rents my apartment. Enjoy it! //
Je suis attache de presse dans le domaine culturel, je loue mon appartement pour pouvoir habiter en France. J'aime voyager, rencontrer des gens de partout dans le monde avec d'autres cultures, la nature, la mer, le soleil, la musique, les films, le théâtre, et profiter de la vie en famille et entre amis. J'aime la liberté, mais je crois qu'elle doit être exercé avec beaucoup de respect pour les autres, donc c'est ce que j'attends de la personne qui loue mon appartement. Profite bien! //
Hola, mi nombre es Gabi. Soy agente de prensa para artistas. Alquilo mi lindo departamento en Buenos Aires porque viajaré a Francia por un tiempo. 
Me encantan los viajes, conocer gente de todo el mundo con otras culturas, la vida al aire libre, el mar, el sol, la música, el cine, el teatro, y disfrutar de la vida con familia y amigos. Amo la libertad, pero creo que debe ser ejercida con mucho respecto por los demás, así que eso es lo que espero de alguien que alquile mi departamento. Espero lo disfruten! //

The space
Our 50m2 Palacio Suite Near San Telmo, with optional breakfast (@$10/night)
The large suite comprises a master bedroom leading to a huge ensuite bathroom with jacuzzi and generously-sized shower. There is also a living room or second bedroom (connected by open doorway). neighborhood_overview:
This is a great neighbourhood with local bakeries, butchers, schools, stationers, ironmongers, haberdashers and supermarkets. Everything you might need is within a block or two.There aren't too many tourists so you can see how locals really live! It's safe, just a few blocks from San Telmo, and also close to lots of tourist spots (see below) so you have the best of both worlds.
The famous Aramburu 5-star"molecular gastronomy" restaurant is just across the road, and his new canteen-style bistrot is also only a few doors away.

name: ::Private Terrace-Big bright studio-Top Location::
description:
Very unique, really quiet, super green and bright studio in the heart of San Telmo. Top location, one block away from Plaza Dorrego and across the San Telmo Market!
But the best of the property is its outdoor roof terrace for private use with a huge couch, Argentine grill, shower and open view.
**Washing machine not available!

The space
In an antique and lately reformed building with only 3 apartments, which did conserve the original and typical architectural values, you will find this astonishing modern studio.
Behind the central patio, you have access via the stairs to the apartment. The studio receives its natural light from the big windows which look upon the patio.
The double bed is extremely comfortable and has 100% cotton sheets. The apartment has a big flat TV & Bose speaker. The kitchen is very well equipped for cooking lovers!
Going upstairs you will find a little dressing room that gives access to a private 25 sq meters terrac
neighborhood_overview:
The apartment is an excellent base for who wants to live in the heart of San Telmo, enjoying the walking area of Defensa street which converted itself into a permanent attraction for its antique shops, and the uncountable amount of artists, musicians, and sculpturists on Sundays.
There are a huge amount of bars and restaurants within walking distance.
Around the corner is the Dorrego square which is a central meeting point for tango dancers with their open-air milonga on Sundays evening and which is also a permanent market full of collector items.
Across the street, you will find the San Telmo market. There are more printed recommendations at the apartment.
host_about:
Hi! I'm half Dutch, half Colombian and grew up in Buenos Aires. I LOVE travelling!
I'm a real owner who has only one property and takes very good care of my apartment and my guests. I've travelled a lot and live abroad at the moment, therefore I know exactly what's important when renting a place to stay away from home.
At the moment I'm not living in Buenos Aires, but my neighbour is a great host too and she's in charge of the apartment.

name: Awesome and cozy room in Palermo!!
description:
Very big room available, with a brand new queen size bed. It´s a 2 bedroom flat, with 2 bathrooms. AC, TV, WIFI. BEST place in BA, close to everything, but quiet. Many bars around. Palemo gardens, Botanical and Zoo are 1 block away. Very safe zone!

The space
You will have your own room. Brand new queen size bed. Shared Bathroom. Most of the commercial centers are located in Palermo. This is an area where you will find many bars, shops, delis and places to buy everything. It is one block from the zoo and the Botanical Gardens, as well as Bosques de Palermo. Best museums in Buenos Aires are located within a few blocks from home (MALBA museum, Evita Museum, and many other) With access to several buses and the subway to take you all around the city. If you need a spare bed, let me know, we can handle it!

Palermo is the trendiest and most beautiful area of Buenos Aires. It is very relaxed neighbourhood, specially on weekends.

Internet; Wi-FI, TV
neighborhood_overview:
I love all the neighbourhood! This ¨barrio¨ is amazing!
It´s also known as Palermo Green, cause it is close to many parks, such as Botanical Gardens, Zoo, and Bosques de Palermo. Many Coffees and bars around. Buses and subway really close. Trendy shops all around. Chilled. It is really quiet, and very safe!! Police station, one block away!
Around the corner are many chics cafés. 50 mts from home, you can`t miss a brunch at Museo Evita Patio!!
host_about:
My favorite destination is to travel anywhere! I love to travel! I`ve been in many countries around the world, such as, Spain, Italy, Thailand, Cambodia, New Zealand, UK, Germany, USA, Cuba, Colombia,  and many others, and also lived in Australia for a year.
I love cooking, I like sports (I practice soccer twice a week, and tennis once.) I like to watch football, I'm a big fan of San Lorenzo, Pope´s team.
I enjoy listening to music, and going out for a couple of drinks with my mates. I love Argentina and everything in it. I was born and raised in the south of Buenos Aires province, but I came to live to BA when I was 18. So that I travel often to my hometown for the weekend.
I'm working full time in Agribusiness.
I like to be informed on political issues of what happens in Argentina as well as in the world, though sometimes that's complicated!
I live in the best neighbourhood of Buenos Aires, near the  Palermo gardens, surrounded by lots of bars as well. Close to buses and subways, it´s a young barrio, with everithing you´ll need in a few blocks.

For tango dancers is ideal as lots of the

My favourite cafes in the immediate surroundings:
La Crespo (Thames 612), Malvon (Serrano y Aguirre), Le Blè (Loyola y Acevedo), Cafe bar y billares San Bernardo (an institution in the hood, Corrientes 5400)

name: Spacious House in Palermo Viejo
description:
I have a beautiful room with exposed brick walls and ceilings available in a shared house in Villa Crespo on the border with Palermo Viejo.

The room features a very comfortable full-sized bed, a desk, a rack for hanging clothes, a shelving unit, a fan, and a radiator for the winter.

The space
The house features two large terraces, a living room with a piano, 2 bathrooms, a small kitchen, and wifi internet access throughout the house. It's a classic Argentine open plan with plants hanging everywhere and a jacaranda growing from the downstairs patio. There are 4 total bedrooms in the house. The house also has 2 cats, so if you are allergic please do not book.

Guest access
Guests are free to use the kitchen, but not to cook meat in the house. They're free to use the living room, but please ask before touching the piano or instruments. Smoking is only allowed on the top upstairs terrace. Ask before using the jacuzzi.
host_about: I'm from Virginia, outside of Washington, DC, and have been telecommuting for several years.  I work in software, and dedicate most of my free time to piano, painting, and drawing.  I'm a sucker for learning new languages, and am currently trying to improve my portuguese.

Also,  2 blocks from the apartment there are several bus lines, subways and trains that connect the entire city.
3 blocks from the apartment is the Plaza Recoleta, the leading trade fair and exhibition center in Buenos Aires.

The second bedroom has two simple beds and a closet. Both bedrooms are lightened and ventilated. name: AltoPalermo renovated 1bdr apartmen
description:
This beautiful, modern and roomy first floor apartment (no lift available) was refurbished only 5 years ago and is conveniently located in the Palermo district, just two blocks away from Santa Fe Avenue, the Alto Palermo shopping center.

The space
This beautiful, modern and roomy first floor apartment (no lift available) was refurbished only 5 years ago and is The flat has a living room with an additional double sofa bed and a dining table for four, a bedroom with a double bed and a fully equipped kitchen. The apartment is equipped with internet access (Wi- Fi), cable TV, air conditioning in the bedroon and in the living room, heating, refrigerator, telephone, dishes, cookware, sheets,

host_about:
Musician, former sociology and journalism student and River Plate fan. As I was born in Venezuela but have lived in Argentina since 11 I`m familiarized with many cultures and life styles. I`ve travelled all around the world since a kid (Europe, US, Caribbean, South America). Big interest in music (rock, folk, reggae, bossa nova, tango, cumbia, funk, hip hop, electronic...), movies (big fan of Tarantino) football (soccer) and reading.
I have lots of recommendations for my guests! restaurants, football matches, typical touristics spots, tango, live music, parks, clothing stores, cool places in the suburbs and many more.

Músico, ex estudiante de sociología y periodismo e hincha fanático de River Plate. Debido a que nací en Venezuela pero vivo en Argentina desde los 11 años, estoy familiarizado con distintas culturas y formas de vivir. Además, he viajado bastante desde niño (Europa, EEUU, Caribe y Sudamérica). Por supuesto, soy amante de la música (rock, folk, reggae, bossa nova, tango, cumbia, funk, hip hop, electronica...), del cine (fanático de Tarantino), del fútbol y me gusta mucho leer.
Tengo miles de recomendaciones para mis huéspedes: restaurantes, bares, discos, festivales de arte, parques, tiendas y cualquier buen lugar que valga la pena tanto en Buenos Aires como en sus alrededores.

The space
Modern and beautiful newly remodeled studio in building with excellent design (by the famous architect A. Virasoro in 1954) and high ceilings. Located in the historic and residential neighborhood of Recoleta, it has a seating area with a comfortable double sofa, coffee table and a vintage chair. Fully equipped kitchen with fridge, oven, microwave, crockery and all necessary utensils for a pleasant stay. The bathroom, large and bright, also has natural ventilation and a comfortable shower. A comfortable bed
defines the bedroom area. The apartment also has air conditioning (hot / cold), Internet (WiFi), TV (flat screen) with cable and local phone. Also there are provided sheets and towels for a plea
neighborhood_overview: The neighborhood is mostly residential but also shops and most of the buildings are old. At the corner of Aguero with Peña is a very good coffee to enjoy coffee, tea, medialunas (Argentine croissant) or simple lunches. I especially recommend the restaurant "La Aguada" (in Billinghurst and Arenales) that serves food of northern Argentina. On the other hand, on the same block, there is a laundry.
